results.title: Survey 12: on paper
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, Michael Bongiovanni, Ray Harris, Robert Lindsay and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Part of a series which looks at individual artists and their works. This program interviews four artists, Micky Allan, Mandy Martin, Sally Robinson and Jenny Watson. Each artist discusses their philosophies, influences, subject matter, background in art, methods, materials and work. Each has been influenced by or incorporates photography in their work.

results.title: Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)
results.creator_credit: Robert Lindsay, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: In 1980 a series of Survey exhibitions was presented at the National Gallery of Victoria. These videos were produced as an introduction to the work of the individual artists represented in the exhibitions.

results.title: Survivors of the Holocaust
results.creator_credit: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions
results.brief_description: Chronicles the events of the Shoah (Holocaust) as witnessed by those who survived. This documentary combines archival footage with the survivor’s personal testamonies and photographs, describing life in pre-war Europe, the devastating impact of Nazism, the liberation of the concentration camps and life fifty years later. The impact of the survivor’s stories prompted Steven Spielberg to establish Survivors of the Shoah Visual History Foundation, a non-profit project to videotape tens of thousands of these personal accounts and make them available for education worldwide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Allan Holzman, James Moll, June Beallor and Turner Original Productions

results.title: Survival of spaceship earth
results.creator_credit: Dirk Summers and United Productions of America
results.brief_description: Fosters an understanding of the effects technological development and human population have had on the earth’s ecology. Features Hugh Downs, Margaret Mead, John D. Rockefeller III, Lady Barbara Ward Jackson, Harrison Brown, and Walter Orr Roberts. Narrated by Raymond Burr.

results.title: Survival in the hills
results.creator_credit: Christopher Were, Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description: Aimed at anyone who is responsible in any way for mountain safety, whether as a leader or merely for themselves. Covers topics including: things that can go wrong; all aspects relating to exposure; suitable food and drinks; how to get help map and compass work; detours; accidents and simple first aid; and a summary of helpful general rules

results.title: Supervising for Service
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Supervisors need to support frontline staff in serving customers by providing on-going training, being available when problems arise, motivating staff and improving poor individual service performance.

results.title: Service Burnout
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Service burnout is a stress reaction suffered by frontline and service staff. Addresses physical and emotional symptoms, effects on customer service, prevention of burnout and how to remedy existing cases of burnout.

results.title: Unhappy Customers
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Unhappy customers promptly tell others about poor service. Offers the philosophy that complaints should be welcomed so that the problem can be resolved, repeat business generated and the now satisfied customer will tell others. Illustrates a step by step method in a range of service settings.

results.title: Selling Our Services
results.creator_credit: Eve Ash, Peter Quarry and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Improving Service”.
All service involves selling and selling entails meeting needs by asking questions and actively listening, giving advice based on product knowledge, bending the rules and taking personal responsibility for problems.
